thread.title: TV | The Late Late Show
thread.title_full: TV | The Late Late Show - entertainment.ie

author: Fiona Flynn
title: TV | The Late Late Show
text:
It's really is a pretty decent Late Late show lineup tonight by all accounts. The one and only Mr Colin Farrell will be on to chat to Ryan his new movie The Lobster, filmed in Sneem, Co Kerry, and life in Hollywood and whatnot.
As well as his good self, the hilarious Pat Shortt will be in fresh from his gig in Vicar Street, to talk about his love of music and the hidden gems he’s uncovered while working on his new series drawn from RTÉ’s music archive.
David Walsh will be on the show, who of course is the famous Irish journalist who exposed notorious drug cheat Lance Armstrong. A story that will be told in upcoming Hollywood flick The Program, where Walsh is played by Chris O'Dowd.
As well as that, controversial UKIP leader Nigel Farage will be telling viewers why he fears immigration and Islam, while Gay rugby star Gareth Thomas will be on to chat about his role in the Guinness advert that got the nation talking and his decision to come out while still professional.
A d, Cavan lads The Strypes will also be performing. So now, not a bad lineup all in all!
